title: How to Make a Pitcher of Pina Colada Floats

steps.headline: Measure the ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the ingredients (except the garnish and ice cream or sherbet) into a pitcher that can hold 100 ounces. Stir the cream of coconut thoroughly before adding it into the pitcher.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the pitcher.
steps.description: Allow the mixture to chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve. This drink can also be served immediately.

steps.headline: Scoop the ice cream into 12-ounce tall glasses.
steps.description: Add a small scoop to the bottom of each glass.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture over the ice cream.
steps.description: Distribute the pitcher mixture evenly between them.

steps.headline: Garnish the drinks.
steps.description: Add a half-slice of pineapple and maraschino cherry on the side of each glass. Add a straw and spoon for convenience.

text: Preparing the Pitcher Measure the ingredients. Pour the ingredients (except the garnish and ice cream or sherbet) into a pitcher that can hold 100 ounces. Stir the cream of coconut thoroughly before adding it into the pitcher. Stir the ingredients. Ensure everything is mixed thoroughly. Refrigerate the pitcher. Allow the mixture to chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve. This drink can also be served immediately. Serving the Cocktails Scoop the ice cream into 12-ounce tall glasses. Add a small scoop to the bottom of each glass. Pour the mixture over the ice cream. Distribute the pitcher mixture evenly between them. Garnish the drinks. Add a half-slice of pineapple and maraschino cherry on the side of each glass. Add a straw and spoon for convenience. Finished.
